radu milos wrote:
> 
> 
> --- Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@...> wrote:
> 
>  > On Tuesday 21 December 2004 15:31, radu milos wrote:
>  > >  Hello,
>  > >
>  > >  I hope to have found a wonderfull class :
>  > ObjectAssert
>  > >  with a wonderfull method :
>  > >  public static void assertSame(java.lang.Object
>  > >  expected,java.lang.Object actual)
>  > >
>  > >  Anyone has any ideeas how the comparison is done
>  > ?
>  >
>  > You can see the code here:
>  >
> http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/junit-addons/junit-addons/src/main/junitx/framework/ObjectAssert.java?rev=1.7.2.1&view=markup 
> <http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/junit-addons/junit-addons/src/main/junitx/framework/ObjectAssert.java?rev=1.7.2.1&view=markup>
>  >
>  > It is a "==" comparison.
>  >
> 
> Is there any chance to be able to find
> a way of testing object equality by having tested the
> values of all the objects' fields?

Yes: override equals() in your classes and use assertEquals().
--
